content.question: A beam of high-velocity electrons is aimed toward two different pairs of narrow slits. Each of the slits can be treated as a source of circular waves. The electron waves are represented in figures <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> by a set of semicircles that are spaced a distance <math alttext="N lambda" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mi>λ</mi></mrow></math> apart. In figure <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the sources are separated by a distance <math alttext="s sub A equals 2 N lambda" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>N</mi><mi>λ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. In figure <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the sources are separated by a distance <math alttext="s sub B equals 3 N lambda" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>N</mi><mi>λ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following describes the effect of a change in slit spacing on the interference pattern that can be observed on a distant screen?

choices.label: Decreasing the slit spacing decreases the spacing of the bright fringes on the screen.
Decreasing the slit spacing decreases the wavelength of the electrons that reach the screen.
Increasing the slit spacing decreases the spacing of the bright fringes on the screen.
Increasing the slit spacing decreases the wavelength of the electrons that reach the screen.

content.answer: Increasing the slit spacing decreases the spacing of the bright fringes on the screen.
